src.pipeline.pipeline module

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper module

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.bye()[source]

Perform cleanup and logging as the pipeline completes.

This function is called at the end of the pipeline to perform any necessary cleanup tasks and log completion messages.

Returns:

None

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.check_db()[source]

Check the database schema for required tables and optionally drop new tables if enabled.

This function checks whether the required database tables exist in the schema. It also provides the option to drop newly created tables if the configuration specifies enabling dropping new tables.

Returns:

None

Parameters:

tbl (str) – Table name.

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.epilog()[source]

Log the completion of processing for an assay endpoint.

This function is called to log the completion of processing for a specific assay endpoint. It can be used to indicate that the processing for a particular assay endpoint has finished.

Returns:

None

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.get_db_config()[source]

Retrieve database configuration parameters from a YAML file.

Reads the database configuration file based on the user’s login name and extracts the necessary parameters.

Returns:

A tuple containing the username, password, host, port, and database name for the MySQL connection.

Return type:

tuple

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.get_metadata(df)[source]

Enhance the input DataFrame with additional metadata and replace missing chemical IDs.

This function takes a DataFrame containing experimental data and enhances it by adding chemical information and replacing missing dsstox_substance_id values based on predefined replacement rules.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing experimental data.

Returns:

Enhanced DataFrame with added chemical information and replaced dsstox_substance_id values.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.get_output_compound(dsstox_substance_id)[source]
src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.get_output_data(aeid=0)[source]

Retrieve output data for a specific AEID.

This function fetches the output data for a given AEID. It determines whether to retrieve the data from a local file, a remote source, or a database query based on configuration settings. The retrieved data is returned as a dataframe.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the output data for the specified AEID.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.get_partition(instance_id, instances_total)[source]

Divide a list of assay endpoints into partitions for distributed processing.

Parameters:

  • instance_id (int) – Instance ID for workload distribution.

  • instances_total (int) – Total number of instances.

Returns:

List of assay endpoint IDs for the given instance.

Return type:

list

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.get_sqlalchemy_engine()[source]

Create a SQLAlchemy database engine.

Returns:

The SQLAlchemy database engine object.

Return type:

sqlalchemy.engine.base.Engine

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.init_aeid(new_aeid)[source]

Initialize the global assay endpoint identifier (AEID).

This function sets the global AEID (assay endpoint identifier) to the provided value. The AEID is used to identify the specific assay endpoint being processed.

Parameters:

new_aeid (int) – The new AEID value to set.

Returns:

None

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.init_config(config)[source]

Initialize the global configuration variable.

Parameters:

config (dict) – Configuration settings.

  • config_path (str) – Path to the configuration file.

  • instance_id (int) – Instance ID for workload distribution.

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.query_db(query)[source]

Execute a SQL query on a MySQL database.

Executes the provided SQL query on a MySQL database. If the query is a DELETE, CREATE, or DROP statement, it is executed using the mysql.connector library. For other queries, an SQLAlchemy engine is used, and the results are returned as a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

query (str) – The SQL query to be executed.

Returns:

If the query is a SELECT statement, returns the query results as a DataFrame.

Otherwise, returns None.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame or None

src.pipeline.pipeline_helper.subset_chemicals(dat)[source]

Subset chemicals based on consensus hit logic and keep the first occurrence.

Parameters:

dat (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing data.

Returns:

Subsetted DataFrame.

Return type:
